com.ibm.watson.dsm.platform.topology.physical

Class InternalPhysicalTopoMonitor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.watson.dsm.platform.topology.registry.AbstractApplicationRegistry
      • com.ibm.watson.dsm.platform.topology.registry.InternalRegistry
        • com.ibm.watson.dsm.platform.topology.physical.InternalPhysicalTopoMonitor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDistributedApplicationRegistry, IPhysicalTopology, IPhysicalTopologyMonitor

    public class InternalPhysicalTopoMonitor
extends InternalRegistry
implements IPhysicalTopologyMonitor
    Used primarily for testing and provides a JVM-local implementation of a monitor that only monitors the applications in the JVM in which it is located.
    Author:
    dawood

      • addPeerListener

        public boolean addPeerListener(IApplicationDescriptor app,
                      IPhysicalTopologyListener l)
        Description copied from interface: IPhysicalTopologyMonitor
        Add a listener to receive notifications of new or removed application peers. Notifications concerning the addition/removal of the given app must not be sent.
        Specified by:
        addPeerListener in interface IPhysicalTopologyMonitor

        Returns:

      • getNeighborPeers

        public java.util.Set<IApplicationDescriptor> getNeighborPeers(IApplicationDescriptor app)
        Description copied from interface: IPhysicalTopology
        Get the list of peer applications that are immediate (one-link) neighbors with the same name space as that of the given app.
        Specified by:
        getNeighborPeers in interface IPhysicalTopology
        Returns:
        never null, but perhaps empty. The returned set does not include the given descriptor.

      • getReachablePeers

        public java.util.Set<IApplicationDescriptor> getReachablePeers(IApplicationDescriptor app)
        Description copied from interface: IPhysicalTopology
        Get the list of reachable application peers (i.e., having the same name space as that given).
        Specified by:
        getReachablePeers in interface IPhysicalTopology

      • getReachablePeers

        public java.util.Set<IApplicationDescriptor> getReachablePeers(IApplicationDescriptor app,
                                                      int hops)
        Description copied from interface: IPhysicalTopology
        Get the list of peers that are reachable within the given number of hops.
        Specified by:
        getReachablePeers in interface IPhysicalTopology
        hops - the number of network links to traverse. 0 or larger, where 0 means peers on the same host (i.e. without a hop between NICs).
        Returns:
        never null, but perhaps empty. The returned set does not include the given descriptor.
